title: Obsessed woman, 25, falsely claimed ex-boyfriend raped her and got her pregnant – even sending him pic of ‘scan’ she downloaded from Google
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments AN obsessed woman who falsely claimed her ex raped her and got her pregnant was facing jail today after the sick hate campaign. 
Jade Morgan, 25, subjected James Grogan to a string of online threats in an attempt to break up his new romance –even sending him pic of ‘her baby scan’ which she had downloaded from Google. Cavendish Press Jade Morgan, pictured outside court, wept as she pleaded guilty to harassment Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd 7 Jade waged a hate campaign against her ex-boyfriend James Grogan subjecting him to a string of online threats 
Despite being issued with a court order banning her from contacting 29-year old Mr Grogan, aspiring funeral worker Morgan bombarded him with up to 60 messages a day. 
In some of the messages Morgan falsely claimed she was pregnant and Mr Grogan was the dad. 
She also sent naked pictures of herself, asked for sex and then wrongly claimed he had raped her. related stories CRAZY PAVING Homeowner who paved over lawn ordered to rip it up or face court by developer he bought house from 'she ruined my life' Cruel fraudster who stole TV psychic Sally Morgan's ID walks free from court 'I'M KNOCKING AT THE DOOR' Obsessed Jemima Khan stalker found guilty of chilling campaign of harassment REAL LIFE WALTER WHITE Property developer faces jail over links to Breaking-Bad style drugs network that dyed crystal meth 'I'LL TAKE YOU TO ANOTHER WORLD' Businesswoman stalked by obsessed admirer who believed he was Greek hero Odysseus 
One said she would contact Mr Grogan’s new girlfriend about her false allegation and added: ”Fine, I’ll send her screenshots and tell her you raped me and the police are investigating it.” 
In one day Mr Grogan, from Oldham, Greater Manchester who has moved away from the UK received 50 messages from Morgan over a nine hour period and also 27 phone calls. 
She also contacted his new girlfriend’s mum over Facebook. Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd Morgan had been issued with a court order banning her from contacting James Grogan Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd 7 Morgan falsely claimed she was pregnant and Mr Grogan was the father and wrongly claimed he had raped her 
In a statement to police Mr Grogan said: “I thought after the restraining order was issues this would all be over with but it just seems to be going on and on. It’s stressing me out, I’m trying to move on and I’m sick of Jade trying to ruin things for me. 
“I had hoped the restraining order would prevent this, I live in a different country, have a new job and Jade is trying to ruin this. 
“She has no reason why she can’t move on with her life as well. Some days she sends 50 to 60 messages. She keeps changing her number but I know it’s her because she sends me pictures of herself. 
“I’ve never seen or been to visit her at all since the court case, I can’t understand why she’s so obsessed with me. I’m worried what Jade will do, she obviously knows where I live.” Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd 7 In one day Mr Grogan received 50 messages from Morgan over a nine hour period and 27 phone calls 
At Blackburn magistrates court Morgan, from Accrington, who is now engaged to another man wept as she pleaded guilty to harassment. JPs said the case was so serious it had to be sent to crown court for sentencing. 
Chairman of the bench John Bolton told her: “Our powers are not sufficient to deal with this. Prepare yourself, you could quite easily be sent to prison for this. I don’t know how you feel but saying that anybody committed rape – I’m a man and I find that disgusting. 
“A baby as well, it’s not nice to be faced with that whether you were joking or serious. Your solicitor said that it’s finished with so show that it’s finished with. You need to keep away from electronic devices, that might be the best thing.” 
The court heard Morgan had met Mr Grogan in May 2014 after meeting through the internet but they split up in February 2016 over her obsessive behaviour which resulted in her getting repeatedly arrested at his home. 
In July 2016 she was issued with a restraining order banning her from contacting Mr Grogan for five years. 
Prosecutor Mrs Enza Geldard said: “Mr Grogan had not wanted the relationship to continue because she seemed a bit unstable. 
“She kept harassing him and that resulted in her being taken to court. 
“He received multiple requests from Snapchat which he believed to be Jade and started to receive messages on WhatsApp messages. 
“He didn’t answer any of the calls of respond to any messages. In some of the messages the defendant makes reference to Mr Grogan’s new partner. He doesn’t know how she knows his new partner.” Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd The couple met in May 2014 after meeting through the internet but they split up in February 2016 over her obsessive behaviour Cavendish Press Morgan will be sentenced in April and was remanded on bail 
Morgan will be sentenced in April and was remanded on bail. 
Her lawyer Jonathan Taylor, said in mitigation: “It’s clear she has found it very difficult to let go of this relationship – but that’s because she herself is a particularly vulnerable individual. 
“Despite the fact the restraining order was put in place she still found it extremely difficult to let go. It’s caused a great deal of upset. 
“There has been no repeat of this, she appears to have moved on and has found a new relationship, she is engaged. She wants to gain employment in the funeral industry and she appears to have finally let go and is not a danger to the public at large. 
On her Facebook page, Morgan appeared to make repeated references about broken relationships. One post on Feb 12 this year said: ”Lads walk all over me and expect me to take them back when they treat me like nothing. Us women don’t need men like that. As the saying goes we are strong and independent.”
